Twentyfive years later Title IX celebrated Equality  Title IX pioneer says struggle is not yet over Karen Gaudette Daily Staff

Twentyfive years ago Dr PERIOD Bernice Sandler testified as an expert before  congressional committees hoping to establish gender equality in academics and athletics.She was on her way with the passage of Title IX.Last night she spoke to  people in the HUB East Ballroom as part of the 25thanniversary celebration of the passage of the national law which bars gender discrimination in education facilities that receive federal funds.She spoke about the efforts of many to end sex discrimination PERIOD We have gone from absolutely horrendous to very bad Sandler said PERIOD But we have also made a tremendous amount of progress.Title IX defines discrimination by the failure of institutions to adhere to gender equality within three main points athletic financial assistance accommodation of athletic interests and abilities and other program areas such as equality in locker space support staff and equipment.Title IX is what makes it possible for us to be athletes here said UW varsity crew member Gretchen Batcheloer a senior in German languages and literature and painting PERIOD Its important for us to be aware.The celebration presented and organized by the ASUW Womens Commission drew a diverse crowd of supporters PERIOD Those in attendance ranged from current students to those who were students during the initial passage of the legislation in .Three speakers took the podium to deliver their experiences with gender discrimination PERIOD Trish Bostrom a former UW tennis player shared her story of being barred from trying out for the UW mens tennis team despite the lack of a formal womens team in the early 70s.Even though I could beat all of the boys I wasnt allowed to compete said Bostrom who in  ranked fifth in the world in doubles PERIOD We need to know our history to find solutions to our current problems with gender discrimination.Marie Tuite the UW associate director for Olympic Sports spoke about the positive effects of Title IX upon young girls PERIOD She said they are less likely to get pregnant and abuse drugs and are more likely to graduate.We the UW lead the nation in equality of athletic participation Tuite said.Dr PERIOD Sandler the keynote speaker rounded out the presentation with some observations PERIOD She said that harassment of females by males is still prevalent because of cutbacks in mens sports to equalize funding distribution.This is something I think were going to see explode in the next couple of years she said PERIOD We are never finished with this type of struggle.We must go on. copyright   The Daily of the University of
